Tucson nods quietly.

" It's not that I completely enjoy it, I do what I mu=
st to defend others and myself.  First rule of thumb, act only in defense, =
and not in offense.  One of Yoketron's golden rules.  I haven't forgotten t=
hem even today."

He had learned a lot from Yoketron, and he thinks back on=
 everything he was taught and how he developed into who he was today.  His =
temper still needed work, and he was aware of his weakness from day one. 

=
" I'll be honest with you, Big Convoy, I sought Yoketron's training because=
 I have a weakness I needed to work on.  I have an extremely short fuse of =
a temper, and I'm still working on it.  As a rookie, I knew right away I ne=
eded to do something about it, so I sought Yoketron's training, which did h=
elp somewhat but not completely.  But what he taught me, I consider it pric=
eless. I hope to return to Yoketron to complete my training, because I do k=
now I have not yet completed it."

He closes his eyes for a moment, and slo=
wly draws his sword into defense position.  His posture changes as he prepa=
res to take a combative pose.  His feet and legs, appear to be ready to spr=
ing into action at a moment's notice.  

" I think we'll be joined shortly =
by unwanted company."
